summary: An FBI intake document recording a phone call from a victim who reported being sex trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein in 1998 when she was 16, and who also reported multiple websites containing child pornography. The caller expressed concern for children's safety and reported being harassed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified by the caller as the sex trafficker who victimized her in 1998. The document's subject is his child sex trafficking case.

events.title: Caller's initial victimization by Epstein
events.description: The caller reports meeting Jeffrey Epstein in 1998 when she was 16 years old and being trafficked by him for money in exchange for sex.

events.title: FBI intake call reporting trafficking and child pornography
events.description: At 10:43 a.m. Eastern Time, a victim called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report being trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein and to report multiple websites containing child pornographic images.

keyFacts: A victim called the FBI on March 22, 2021, to report being sex trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein, stating she met him in 1998 when she was 16.
The caller reported eight specific websites (e.g., portraitsofgirls.com, vipergirls.com) that she stated contain pornographic images of children aged 5 to 17, with most appearing under 14.
The caller indicated she had been referred to the FBI by the NYPD Special Victims Unit and had obtained a contact number from Safe Horizon, a victim services agency.
The caller reported a pattern of harassment/stalking and had notified the NY police about it.
The document is an official FBI intake record, creating a new case ID (50D-NY-3027571) related to Jeffrey Epstein and child sex trafficking.
